result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jeffery Randall Westling was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:38 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Jeffery Randall Westling in court.  Attorney A.W. Schutte in court for Jeffery Randall Westling.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Set for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  ADA Ballo recites agreement. Atty Schutte agrees. Defendant pleads NO CONTEST to Count 1- OWI 4th. S/T Defendant. Direct by Court. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs Defendant of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds Defendant guilty to Count 1- OWI 4th. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Count 2. Sentencing arguments. Court addresses Defendant.

Court orders:

Count 1

270 days jail to commence immediately
- 2 days credit
- Huber authorized
- $2,629 Fine inclusive of costs   to be added to payment plan through Clerk of Court
- $52 blood draw to SCSO   to be added to payment plan through Clerk of Court
- 30 months revocation
- 30 months IID
- AODA and Driver's Safety Plan
- DNA sample


Defendant to continue making monthly payments. Defendant remanded into custody. Adjourned at 10:56 AM.  gll

-$1,000 bond on file. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing 4 times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Bela Alexander Ballo   DF ATTY:  A.W. Schutte   DF:  Jeffery Randall Westling appeared. Case called at 11:47 a.m. Court scheduled this matter for a bail bond hearing based on JSC report. ADA Ballo states DE had a positive test. Atty Schutte was aware of the result. Gives explanation. DE is currently trying to pay the fee for an assessment. Court will not make any amendments to bond at this time. If any further positive tests, may need to look at amending bond. Atty Schutte requesting matter be scheduled for plea. Court schedules. Address confirmed. Bond continues.
